title: English as a Second Language (Anchor Language Standards for All Grades)
subject: English Language Arts (2005-2010)

4400F5A745764FB09A82F65E4FD592BA.description: Apply rubric criteria to evaluate writing.

90FD44F8FBC24B9CBB91FE9D93DE88FA.description: Proofread writing for appropriateness of organization, content, style, and conventions.

175451D2F1F1461595A64EB8C96E9A01.description: Use analogies, quotations and facts to support a thesis.

83DBCCA6858B4A29A23920FF3D796A44.description: Write to inform such as to explain, describe, report, and narrate.

C0007A2E45464BBC960589E07A36CABE.description: Organize and record expository information on pictures, lists, charts, and tables for literature and content area.

CAB1038B3F6C4848B082F0898920949C.description:
Writing Proficiency Level 5: Benchmark: Students, at grade level, produce fluent academic writing using language 
                       structures, technical vocabulary, and appropriate writing conventions to access         
                       the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 2, ELA 3, ELA 7)

C560C7A722404E7E9647BAB72A390118.description: Begin writing in a variety of genres.

C03BCA65DBAD4EFF9AF57E82C7773CE5.description: Edit and revise writing for grammar and content.

B517C455AD0B45048D3F6FB571B34BB0.description: Write a three-paragraph essay about a topic.

AC034869862C49CFB4C1A8D16ADCDCB4.description: Spell derivatives correctly by applying the spelling of bases and affixes.

D1EC0B4353134952B6DBCE13219799EB.description: Write the accurate spelling of roots such as drink, speak, read, or happy, inflections such as those that change tense or number, suffixes such – able or –less, and prefixes such as re-  or un-.

0B705BC0D27D4A77BE6B6041EA42C2B2.description: Use correct spelling of frequently used words in writing and containing affixes, contractions, compounds and common homophones, and words necessary to topic in English.

9FDCF57224B34967AE0280CCD369C207.description: Use resources to find correct spellings, synonyms, and replacement words.

1C17B62052B9495B9894FB20390E1051.description: Use planning strategies before writing (e.g.: process writing, graphic organizers) Converse on simple topics beginning to use most conventions of oral language including intonation, syntax and grammar (subject-verb agreement, complete sentences and correct tense).

DF7C4CF3155344A5B233B4552EC86774.description:
Writing Proficiency Level 4: Benchmark: Students, approaching grade level, write multi-paragraph essays, journal entries, 
                      personal and business letters, and creative texts in an organized fashion in both 
                      social and academic core subject areas.  (ELA 2, ELA 3)

0D1B3DA9CD904DCE8AB55DB881FAC6FE.description: Edit writing for punctuation, capitalization and spelling.

FACC339583694229B73A2E31108A20E5.description: Write friendly notes and letters (e.g.: thank you notes).

5F5F3E0505644519ABB0D821E5964213.description: Write with more proficient spelling of inflectional endings, including plurals and past tense and words that drop the final e when such endings as – ing, ed, or able are added, correctly use apostrophes in contractions and possessives.

7190AB0A4FA94C61AAC94D9E9C50DD62.description: Write multiple sentences around a topic.

2DB88488CF7E41F3855642D4230310EA.description: Use basic grammatical constructions in simple sentences.

1E0F6EDC8B02461F95F9C6A851000759.description: Identify complete and incomplete sentences in writing in English.

166A8B0EF2DF4A0D8DCBC0ED7F2120E3.description:
Writing Proficiency Level 3: Benchmark: Students write simple texts, correspondence and short reports using high frequency 
                      language and continue to access the curriculum in core subject areas.
                      (ELA 2, ELA 3)

7536615F7E7C4590A0435B5B8920CDF6.description: Begin to demonstrate knowledge of paragraph structure.

D0B15896E78F4DFA81D05A63C1A84950.description: Fill out simple forms with personal information with support.

95C4CE6C0D7D423A9F1A754B5309340F.description: Write labels, notes, captions for illustrations, possessions, charts and centers.

FE5B0E244A594393B600E3988A82BDE1.description: Use correct punctuation at end of sentence.

71D2E04884A047ADBD0CE437DD1149F7.description: Produce several simple sentences on a topic.

314EDD8275B544BEB7FB82FFD5771087.description:
Writing Proficiency Level 2: Benchmark: Students compose short informative passages on familiar topics and continue to 
                       access the curriculum in core subject areas.	
                       (ELA 2, ELA 3).

EC83C8609B584F71AC40256AD7895324.description: Capitalize first words of a sentence, proper nouns, and initials (e.g.: names, months, days of the week).

E88A0EB4C816497FAD5017F6AEE69AB6.description: Label key parts of common objects.

F718CC3B3FC54EEF96424B52E56522DF.description: Copy words posted and commonly used in the classroom.

40FA6F9FCFFD48A0B4F616CA47037DA2.description: Print legibly using correct spacing between letters and words and sentences.

0F7BC9A5FEB04BF9BF67CB064AFA0D4A.description: Write his/her own name and other important words.

FD7DE6EC3CE642FEBE608C6FBBAE3B80.description: Print legibly using left to right, top to bottom directionality.

55F46EEEE78440B4BFC88585D714074E.description: Print upper and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

C47AC1CCD8024551A0F0DC0784216B16.description: Draw or copy from a model.

97F76A2E9A534FFDAFAA520BE5FA7815.description:
Writing Proficiency Level 1:  Benchmark: Students demonstrate growth in communicative writing skills to begin to access the 
                      curriculum in core subject areas.  (ELA 2, ELA 3 )

0A92B160DC7B4DF0BEF9F5A43EDB1964.description: Organize, evaluate, and condense information for use in a presentation or writing.

72EAEE3D5F1944B380210DA4868F7887.description: Analyze, evaluate, and draw conclusion by providing evidence presented in the text.

1F6032725F5B4F07ABECA9E616CB44FD.description: Name and analyze story plot, setting and conflict.

DB9900C2662C4457B7D99CE930EECC7A.description: Draw correlation from literature and links to real life situations.

46ECC6226251499A8C9088F120B0AB5D.description: Comprehend material from a variety of genres.

9A73E7048CEB4D6F83433BFD52F1A3A2.description: Create artwork or a written response that shows comprehension of a selection.

5FC08DDD3E8D4A749EDE8F54E64BF1FA.description: Reading Proficiency Level 5: Benchmark : Students understand a wide range of both social and academic texts available to native English speakers at grade level.  (ELA 1, 5,6,7)

8E62779293DD454C9D73FD300993FDE1.description: Distinguish between main idea and supporting details.

4D37110B5D0943F7B65FE0B184BF6CEA.description: Use reference materials including the glossary, dictionary, index thesaurus, almanac, atlas, and multi-media resources.

4080592177B54FEAB03EFB1FE0F8B542.description: Rely on context clues to determine meaning.

55DB9137794E4B98A60B9826157178F7.description: Apply knowledge of word relationships, such as root and affixes to derive meaning from literature and texts in content area.

1BA174B1E0E74C0AB15D1FD02D45DC9D.description: Recognize most common English morphemes in phrases and sentences.

BFC2CEB17D9743C6B3D6AD03A5C5322F.description: Interact independently with a variety of texts.

815E3151FCB5401A849EFA2DCA73F8AF.description: Reading Proficiency Level 4: Benchmark: Students, approaching grade level, understand the content of most text with support in academic content areas.  (ELA 1, 5,6,7)

9C2F4BF847FF4AC882E8A9A1571D0FB9.description: Recognize the format of poetry versus prose.

4916AFB823CC4746B6C8BED5B4011CF8.description: Recognize and use knowledge of spelling patterns when reading.

37561DC112D34C9193DF44CF0864F60A.description: Locate the meanings, pronunciations and derivations of unfamiliar words using dictionaries, glossaries, and other sources.

D956773AE03E4D0C9812332AE6DB126B.description: Use capitalization and punctuation to comprehend.

67ACE1482C054BFFBE4CDB5F8498DF53.description: Reading Proficiency Level 3: Benchmark: Students understand a more complex narrative and descriptive materials within a familiar context to continue to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 1, 5,6,7)

C938C078199347088007DCFA8EE9A017.description: Recognize basic word order rules in phrases, simple sentences, or simple text.

C422DBBF9E2342C9A6CB2DFFA555B1D4.description: Use cognates for academic or social comprehension.

E903BC5E82034510BD0E27591D7EF669.description: Read common word families and simple sentences.

310F263C8F914C2492FD1C4748344E5A.description: Use pictures to make predictions about the text.

9B67606E566F4B7AA3BC871568E4D265.description: Use prior knowledge to interpret pictures.

759FF21612984AA0AEBA71CBA418B249.description:
Reading Proficiency Level 2: Benchmark: Students understand simple material for academic or social purposes to continue to access the curriculum in core subject areas.
(ELA 1,5,6,7)

4E76205829554AC19824F603A9CA731D.description: Use emerging reading skills to make meaning from print.

0D2A7A4ED81A4E9F842296C1A85AB940.description: Read simple one syllable and high frequency words when strongly supported by context (e.g.: basic sight words).

BE226F9AB1D0494A92F63B204B25700E.description: Match oral words to printed words or graphics.

53DB89A1711A4C3CA3C29EC43D17C79B.description: Recognize phonetic pronunciation of the letters of the alphabet.

C3C7F5172F3B4D22B033F6BEE682C410.description: Know the difference between capital and lowercase letters.

EC123D0D1EF2446092CBA39EF9890C63.description: Recognize the order of the alphabet and form of letters, and Arabic numbers.

C53E341D03F345F6B637489559003B8C.description: Identify words from left to right and top to bottom on the printed page.

82F16B8D5A2A47EC9EA14CDF76F7FF1F.description: Distinguish individual printed letters from words and sentences.

E75FBE30226D417EBB1C5A14C04797E5.description: Hold print material in the correct position.

F41D3FDF8DF8404C9161AC7985290F25.description: Reading Proficiency Level 1: Benchmark: Students develop initial print awareness and begin to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 1, 5,6,7)

7BC5B658E1FE488788997E0031A92B7A.description: Louisiana English Language Development: Reading Standards

DA1557D2D8004C3E95BDD25355806339.description: Negotiate with confidence using complex language structures for expression of personal view of abstract ideas.

CCC710AAABE94A8095DB229AEF9A56B6.description: Explain abstract tasks and/or concepts with appropriate sequencing taking into account the listener’s perspective.

8E39D5AF57F9459B8C1D49788A36052C.description: Prepare and deliver extended oral presentations that follow a process of organization using a variety of sources for a research project.

67F302CCEEEF4D3EB912BD9A0469A91F.description: Demonstrate effective communication skills that reflect such demands as interviewing, reporting, requesting, and providing information.

8CC8FEB27B1A4798AE702E5280471B9E.description: Actively participate and initiate more extended social conversations or discussions with peers and adults on familiar or unfamiliar topics by making relevant contributions, asking and answering questions, restating and soliciting information.

D85D84317174405A885BF2C7DD5AEF09.description: Use effective, rate, volume, pitch and tone for the audience setting.

F897B5D44E3B450A80C967AA2350165E.description: Adapt spoken language such as word choice, diction, and usage to the audience, purpose and occasion.

212582DB64124BB994452CA03C3823B3.description: Speaking Proficiency Level 5: Benchmark: Students on grade level engage in social and academic communication with mastery of complex language structures in varied situations. (ELA 4,7)

43548367293C4E8F969D83D042FB495E.description: Persuade, argue or reason to support spoken ideas with evidence, elaborations and examples.

45E3C39F32E64D279BC38F4731453DB1.description: Use a variety of idiomatic expressions and figurative language appropriately.

727870A322EE4EF4AA179CAA3027B0BF.description: Use the conventions of oral language effectively including intonation, syntax and grammar (e.g.: subject-verb agreement, complete sentences and correct tense).

82214B7425C747C5B06FBA5AE9289ED3.description: Communicate effectively in conversations and group discussions while problem solving and planning.

E22257EAC0DD4957BF25D9ADBFF56901.description: Respond to factual questions about texts read aloud

F1364AE936F343B6A9A02BB8826EE4E1.description: Recognize appropriate ways of speaking that vary based on purpose, audience, and subject matter.

9B22393AFE2A4664B5007DFED34F1438.description: Speaking Proficiency Level 4: Benchmark: Students approaching grade level communicate with confidence in most situations with support in academic areas. (ELA 4,7)

6D576AFDD5984E0CBEA9EBA2F640B622.description: Prepares and delivers short oral presentations (e.g.: tells a story using pictures, academic topic).

55A0C77D4FAE4A3BAFC2C7A7F88E89F1.description: Ask and answer instructional questions about simple written texts with simple words and phrases.

90484DE05BA048A58790C9CAC8275608.description: Retell and paraphrases familiar stories with simple sentences.

9850143A45C64DC490470F3900C8E3BA.description: Converse on simple topics beginning to use most conventions of oral language including intonation, syntax and grammar (subject-verb agreement, complete sentences and correct tense).

2674A7CCE245467F98315D2FDFFAA077.description: Ask and answer questions to gather and provide information in English.

C35274F5AB934AE8AED0656A9B1D185E.description: Speaking Proficiency Level 3: Benchmark: Students initiate and sustain a simple conversation in social and core academic settings. (ELA 4,7)

15CC5A8AD3A04F028031270F1FE7437B.description: Respond to factual questions about texts read aloud.

7927E77EF0C54CBBB7F7447370C7B4B5.description: Ask and answer questions using simple phrases or sentences.

9D60153D99E64315ACA044A503B97883.description: Ask and give information such as directions, address, name, age and nationality.

B0D70854360241D39485660CC0B0318A.description: Name people, places, objects, events and basic concepts such as days of the week, food, occupations and time.

B79432CE38A14610A64BB30BF59A6C73.description: Speaking Proficiency Level 2: Benchmark: Students use appropriate strategies to initiate and respond to simple statements and questions to continue to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 4)

90F3D92A618B4C3B94C87844BE42C5AC.description: Generate a few words, phrases with basic English grammatical form and phonemic accuracy.

29F56B7643374187BBB527A7DE9AAFE3.description: Communicate basic needs, wants and feelings.

449BAA729AEE4BF3A2DBD8FC0E70EB15.description: Answer simple questions with one and two-word responses.

FE446FF2F69640C99493FD03E9EAC76E.description: Communicate using common social greetings and simple repetitive phrases.

BA149F065A70491AA4FA92212BE7C91A.description: Communicate with gestures and non-verbal modalities.

9A50017BC1AC4BA799F278BED5D44EDA.description: Speaking Proficiency Level 1: Benchmark: Students will show growth in oral communication using high frequency learned words and phrases to begin to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 4)

352662452A924BB09C6EC78C29144AC5.description: Louisiana English Language Development: Speaking Standards

7FEB8A875C024F39BC88549ADD7F609D.description: Identify, analyze and imitate a speaker’s persuasive techniques such as selling, convincing, and using propaganda.

5F8709579DEB4521AA2469E73AF95DA1.description: Demonstrate comprehension of, and appropriate listener response to ideas in a persuasive speech, and oral interpretation of literacy sections, interviews, in a variety of real-life situations, and educational and scientific presentations.

3CC2B5D76045430BAC9AA599E9776497.description: Differentiate between the speaker’s opinion and verifiable fact.

D91A4E3AE13F443C81E42A2F3A3E5FD6.description: Listening Proficiency Level 5: Benchmark: Students master comprehension of standard speech at grade level in both social and core academic settings. (ELA 7)

932BC8A71328485CB73FD630685DC68E.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and idiomatic expressions by responding to and using such expressions appropriately.

6C5A86B620624B2189387A260CD5DEAB.description: Use effective listening to provide appropriate feedback in a variety of situations such as conversations and discussions and informative, persuasive, or artistic presentations.

C1612902875F4119BD3660E42A43C213.description: Listen to proficient, fluent models of oral reading, including selections from classic and contemporary works.

0D2DE9E489F14669B10CF23458B16458.description: Listening Proficiency Level 4: Benchmark: Students understand speech in most authentic situations with some repetition and rewording in both social and core academic settings  approaching grade level. (ELA 6)

BB9916A62D2F426AB65B706F43ED9378.description: Identify a variety of media messages and give some supporting details.

DAB01BA4400B413A8D9DF74576DAAA0A.description: Listen attentively to stories/information and identify main idea, key details and concepts using both verbal and non-verbal cues of the speaker.

CBAB03906F66449E97A6FF2DCCFBD3AC.description: Demonstrate proficiency of the listening process such as focusing attention, interpreting and responding to topics in everyday situations.

6311A466B36343C097277B3423786BA4.description: Listening Proficiency Level 3: Benchmark: Students comprehend simple narratives and structures in short interactions with peers and adults and continue to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 5)

F2F53501CA804613A4DC3488C409C26C.description: Assess how language choice reflects the tone of the message.

82643321E45F42E1BE59AC3D5802C76B.description: Interpret speaker’s message, purpose, and perspectives (e.g.: inflection, intonation and stress).

2FA52DC4EBEB49C6AC891666F4633883.description: Follow multi-step oral directives to complete a task.

28A7B8F1D6BB4820993C1A206A0D89DC.description: Comprehend key words, phrases and/or sentences with basic English grammatical forms.

61D3675DF15343F38E988EB8045F4292.description: Understand basic structures, expressions, and vocabulary such as school environment and basic personal information (e.g.: home address, phone number, emergency number).

3DC8E6B5E90741CDB1C343235B6B3E23.description: Begin to dicsriminate the sounds and intonation patterns of the English language.

F95C1108575B4FDFA25F68952227DBBD.description: Listening Proficiency Level 2: Benchmark: Students comprehend simple statements, directions, and questions and continue to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 4)

11226C28FD1043148561EB9AA0D329F8.description: Comprehend a few words, phrases with basic English grammatical forms.

39A14F39D0F7439DA88A41FA32E6740E.description: Listen to and imitate others' use of language.

36462B7A39F94DCC807D7826BEB35F11.description: Respond to simple directions or instructions.

0EBC32E715B440D897986C629CB974BD.description: Respond correctly to high frequency social conventions (e.g.: greetings, introductions, leave taking etc.).

A8DD9CEC9A674184B6F9024592A8F3C7.description: Listening Proficiency Level 1: Benchmark: Students demonstrate growth in comprehension of oral language and begin to access the curriculum in core subject areas. (ELA 4)

AD2574663A5142E88344558799B56D0C.description: Louisiana English Language Development: Listening Standards
